name: Warehouse Location â€“ CR2 (Feasibility by Distance)
content: Stores may only be supplied by warehouses that are within an acceptable delivery radius. Each store has a predefined set of warehouses it can be feasibly served from. Any warehouse outside this feasible service region cannot supply that store. Everything else about operations, capacity, and costs remains unchanged.
value_info: `capacities`: List of integers, where capacities[j] gives the maximum number of stores that warehouse j can serve.
`supply_cost`: 2D list where supply_cost[i][j] is the supply cost if store i is served from warehouse j.
`allowed`: 2D binary matrix (same shape as supply_cost) where allowed[i][j] = 1 means warehouse j may supply store i.

var1.descr: `w`: List of warehouse assignments for each store. w[i] is the warehouse index serving store i.

var2.descr: `o`: Binary list of open warehouses. o[j] = 1 means warehouse j is used.

var3.descr: `total_cost`: Total supply cost plus warehouse opening costs.
